meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inhospitable.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitableness of the desert made it difficult for any plants to grow.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitableness of the hotel staff made the guests feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitableness of the snowstorm was evident as it refused to let anyone pass through.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitableness of the rocky terrain seemed to repel any visitors.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitableness of the haunted house sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: The lack of warmth or friendliness in a place or environment.
meanings.sent1: The inhospitableness of the office made it hard for employees to feel comfortable.
meanings.sent2: The inhospitableness of the city streets left the tourists feeling lost and alone.
meanings.sent3: The inhospitableness of the cat's stare made me wonder if it was plotting something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The inhospitableness of the old library seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The inhospitableness of the dark alley made me quicken my pace to get out.
